Projects.name: Toquí
Projects.description: Toquí was a hotel managing, promoting and booking app developed at Universidad Cenfotec while coursing “Proyecto de Ingeniería de Software II”. Toquí was developed using a .NET MVC Web Application for the Front-End and a series of REST API's connected to C# projects and an SQL database for the Back-End. The whole project was developed using Microsoft technologies as a challenge so we had to learn how to use tools like C#, Team Foundation Services (for version control), SQL Server 2017, Visual Studio 2019 and several different services from the AzurePortal which helped us get the project from ideas and sequence diagrams to a fully functional application running completely on the cloud.

Projects.name: Client Panel
Projects.description: This project was developed on my spare time following Brad Traversy's “React Front to Back” course on Udemy. It was a client balance managing app created using ReactJS with Redux for the Front-End, and FireBase for the Back-End and data storage.

Projects.name: Reinos Cenfotecos
Projects.description: Reinos Cenfotecos was castle attack game that consisted in placing terrains and using them to get pieces to the enemy castle to steal their gold. It was developed using ReactJS for the Front-End, and a Spring Boot Application connected to H2 for the Back-End. This was the final project por our Design Patterns course and had more than 9 different GoF Design Patterns such as: Proxy, Lightweight, Abstract Factory, and more...

Projects.name: FitSwap
Projects.description: FitSwap was marketplace and social network for local clothing brand and other types of textile entreperneurs to sell and swap their products for other similar items with the community. It was developed using ReactJS for the Front-End, and a Spring Boot Application connected to PostreSQL for the Back-End. This was the final project for our Component Programming course and it was presented at ExpoCenfo as one of the best projects of the last quarter of 2020 because of it's continious deployment environment using AWS technologies.
